text: Sveta Petka is a village in the municipality of Bujanovac, Serbia. According to the 2002 census, the village has a population of 334 inhabitants. It has an area of 55.69 km². == Population == {| align="center" cellspacing="0" style="background:#f3fff3" |+ style="margin-bottom:0.5em;font-size:1.1em;font- weight:bold" | Population of Sveta Petka |- bgcolor="#77dd77" | align="center" | 1948 | align="center" | 1953 | align="center" | 1961 | align="center" | 1971 | align="center" | 1981 | align="center" | 1991 | align="center" | 2002 |- | align="center" | 323 | align="center" | 341 | align="center" | 319 | align="center" | 295 | align="center" | 308 | align="center" | 307 | align="center" | 334 |} ==References== Category:Populated places in Pčinja District
title: Sveta Petka, Bujanovac
